# backItem

**Instance Property**

The navigation item that is immediately below the topmost item on a navigation bar’s stack.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var backItem: UINavigationItem? { get }
```

## Discussion

If the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UINavigationItem/leftBarButtonItem] property of the topmost navigation item is `nil`, the navigation bar displays a back button whose title is derived from the item in this property.

If there is only one item on the navigation bar’s stack, the value of this property is `nil`.

## Pushing and popping items

- **pushItem(_:animated:)**: Pushes the given navigation item onto the navigation bar’s stack and updates the UI.
- **popItem(animated:)**: Pops the top item from the navigation bar’s stack and updates the UI.
- **setItems(_:animated:)**: Replaces the navigation items currently managed by the navigation bar with the specified items.
- **items**: An array of navigation items managed by the navigation bar.
- **topItem**: The navigation item at the top of the navigation bar’s stack.
